item.description: Structure Fire - Now Out; INC#0190; 04:31AM; 22125 W Roscoe Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3xUFG9g; #WestHills; 55 LAFD Firefighters took just 32 minutes (5:03 AM) to isolate and fully extinguish fire within a laundry room at a one-story skilled nursing facility. Twenty of the ninety patients were safely evacuated in their beds outdoors to be closely attended by nursing staff, while the others were safely sheltered in place within the facility, as smoke was effectively isolated by the building's room and sectional fire doors. None of the patients or staff have medical complaints related to the fire. Firefighters are using high-powered portable fans to further clear residual smoke, to allow all patients and staff to soon be rehoused. The fire's cause is under investigation.; FS 106; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 12; BC15 BC17 CM42 E104 E106 E107 E273 E293 E296 E305 E73 E84 EM17 RA104 RA105 RA106 RA896 RA96 T105 T73 T93 T96; CH9; 17 18; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#2012; 11:09PM; NB 405 Fwy south of Skirball Center Drive; MAP: https://bit.ly/3jxvv4y; #Brentwood; PRELIM: Three vehicle traffic collision (pickup truck, overturned big rig and another big rig). Unknown cargo. No fire. At least two patients. Debris in lanes. No further details. Media Inquiries: CHP West LA (Log #3060).; FS 19; Batt 9; West Bureau; Council District 11; E19 E237 E71 RA19 T37; CH4; 13; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#1494; 06:03PM; 310 N Newland St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3u69gHP; #HighlandPark; 32 Firefighters took just 27 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish stubborn flames within a *two-story* Craftsman-style home. Fire was prevented from extending to the adjacent garage. One adult female resident was evaluated for minor medical complaints and released at the scene. She will be displaced by the fire, the cause of which remains under investigation.; FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC2 E12 E201 E203 E212 E42 E55 RA12 T1 T12 T3; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#1494; 05:36PM; 310 N Newland St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3u69gHP; #HighlandPark; PRELIM: 1 story Craftsman-style home with fire to the rear, threatening an adjacent garage.; FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC2 E12 E201 E212 E55 RA12 T1 T12; CH9; 13; Brian Humphrey

Traffic Collision; INC#0960; 12:50PM; 19300 W Roscoe Bl; MAP: https://bit.ly/3y1iYfx; #Reseda; PRELIM: LAFD EMS Captain responding to an emergency was involved in a three vehicle collision. No civilian injury. LAFD Captain will be transported to an area hospital for clinical evaluation of non-life threatening injury. Media Inquires: LAPD Valley Traffic Division (Incident #2366); FS 104; Batt 17; Valley Bureau; Council District 3; BC15 BC17 E104 EM15 RA903 RA93; CH8; 18; Brian Humphrey

Knockdown - Structure Fire; INC#0550; 09:28AM; 807 N Bridewell St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3OOzt5H; #HighlandPark; 35 LAFD Firefighters, joined by neighboring South Pasadena Firefighters in Automatic Aid, took just 21 minutes to access, confine and fully extinguish an exterior fire that extended into the first and second floors of a 2 story residential duplex (apartments over parking), preventing fire damage to neighboring structures. No injury. Fire cause under investigation.; FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC2 E12 E201 E212 E447 E55 RA47 RA844 T1 T12 + South Pasadena FD E81 BC9 in Automatic Aid; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey

Structure Fire; INC#0550; 09:07AM; 805 N Bridewell St; MAP: https://bit.ly/3y0WwmQ; #HighlandPark; PRELIM: Outside fire extended into a 2 story residential duplex, threatening at least one neighboring structure. Units from neighboring South Pasadena Fire Department have responded in Automatic Aid.; FS 12; Batt 2; Central Bureau; Council District 14; BC2 E12 E201 E212 E447 E55 RA47 RA844 T1 T12 + South Pasadena FD E81 BC9 in Automatic Aid ; CH9; 14; Brian Humphrey

Agency Assist; INC#0470; 08:25AM; 5600 W Imperial Hw; MAP: https://bit.ly/3nkLfsF; #ElSegundo; LAFD Assisting the El Segundo Fire Department with a multi-patient traffic collision in their jurisdiction. Media Inquiries: El Segundo Police and Fire.; LAFD BC4 E264 E295 E51 E95 EM18 RA51 RA64 RA95 T64 T95 Assisting El Segundo FD in Automatic Aid; CH4; 13; Brian Humphrey

title.a: Update Brush Fire - Oro Fire 06/27/2022 INC#1674

item.description: Update Brush Fire - Oro Fire; INC#1674; 12:10AM; 11250 N Big Tujunga Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3A0Unua; Sunland; Firefighters have now reached the fire on the ground. It is located in heavy brush. There are no winds. They are getting handlines in place but it will take time given the terrain. There are no structures threatened and no injuries reported. . Some LAFD resources are being released and a scaled down response will handle. No further incident updates are expected to be released; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 BP74 E24 E274 E289 E298 E60 E7 E77 E89 E90 E98 EM14 H2 H3 H5 HA2 HA3 RA74 T74 T89 T98 WT77; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart

Update Brush Fire; INC#1674; 11:41PM; 11250 N Big Tujunga Canyon Rd; MAP: https://bit.ly/3A0Unua; Sunland; Fire is updated to less than 1/4 acre in an area difficult to access by ground. LAFD helicopters made water drops while firefighters work their way to reach it with handlines. All LA County Fire resources are being released and this will be handled by LAFD only. No additional resources are expected to be required. There are no structures threatened and no evacuations in place. There are no injuries reported.; FS 74; Batt 12; Valley Bureau; Council District 7; AO1 AO2 BC12 BC14 BP74 E24 E274 E289 E298 E60 E7 E77 E89 E90 E98 EM14 H2 H3 H5 HA2 HA3 RA74 T74 T89 T98 WT77; CH5; 17; Margaret Stewart
